Hindari Wartawan, Kepala Bapenda Kota Bekasi Kabur Panjat Tembok?
07 Nov 2019, 16:00 by Adi Warsono (Kontributor), Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Bekasi - Kepala Badan Pendapatan Daerah (Bapenda) Kota Bekasi, Aan Suhanda, memilih kabur dari wartawan yang menungguinya menjalani pemeriksaan di Kepolisian Resor Metro Bekasi Kota, Kamis, 7 November 2019. Aan diperiksa perihal penarikan pungutan parkir minimarket yang melibatkan organisasi masyarakat atau ormas.
Seperti diketahui, kebijakan menciptakan polemik karena sebagian minimarket menolak dan berujung unjuk rasa aliansi ormas. Video unjuk rasa itu viral karena ormas didukung Kepala Bapenda mengintimidasi pengusaha agar bersedia 'bekerja sama'.
Aan Suhanda diperiksa selama delapan jam di ruang penyidikan terpadu. Aan tiba di sana pukul 10.00 dan baru selesai pemeriksaan pukul 18.00. Tapi, setelah selesai pemeriksaan, Aan memilih keluar gedung melalui pintu belakang lalu diduga memanjat pagar.
"Aku gak tahu, yang pasti tadi dia bilang telalu letih untuk bisa bertemu teman-teman (wartawan)," kata kuasa hukum Aan Suhanda, RM Purwadi, saat diminta konfirmasinya tentang kliennya yang nekat memanjat pagar.
Menurut Purwadi, Aan memilih langsung pulang ke rumah untuk istirahat. Karena itu, Aan meminta disampaikan maaf tak bisa melayani wartawan.
Berdasarkan pengamatan Tempo, jejak Kepala Bapenda Kota Bekasi itu memanjat pagar setinggi 1,5 meter berupa dua kursi plastik yang bersandar ke tembok. Seorang pekerja bangunan di balik tembok menguatkan dugaan itu karena mengaku melihat ada seorang mengenakan pakaian batik masuk ke sebuah minibus.

Avoid Journalists, Head of Bekasi City Bapenda, Fleeing Wall Climbing?
07 Nov 2019, 16:00 by Adi Warsono (Contributor), Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Bekasi - Head of Bekasi City's Regional Revenue Agency (Bapenda), Aan Suhanda, chose to run away from reporters who waited for him to undergo examination at the Bekasi City Metro Resort Police, Thursday, November 7, 2019. Aan was questioned regarding the withdrawal of minimarket parking fees involving organizations community or mass organizations.
As is known, the policy creates a polemic because some minimarkets refuse and result in demonstrations by CSO alliances. The demonstration video was viral because mass organizations supported by the Head of Bapenda intimidated entrepreneurs into being willing to 'work together'.
Aan Suhanda was examined for eight hours in the integrated investigation room. Aan arrived there at 10:00 and only finished checking at 18:00. But, after finishing the inspection, Aan chose to exit the building through the back door and then allegedly climbed the fence.
"I don't know, for sure he said that he was too tired to meet friends (reporters)," said legal counsel Aan Suhanda, RM Purwadi, when asked for his confirmation about his client who was determined to climb the fence.
According to Purwadi, Aan chose to go straight home to rest. Because of this, Aan apologized that he could not serve reporters.
Based on Tempo's observations, the footsteps of the Head of Bapenda of Bekasi City climbed a 1.5 meter high fence in the form of two plastic chairs leaning against the wall. A construction worker behind the wall corroborates the allegation because he claims to see a man wearing batik clothes get into a minibus.
